version_description: A few UI/UX improvements.
Bug fixed.
Bug fixes.
Bug fixes.

1.IR library improvements.
2.Bug fixes.

New features:
1. Hub Plus now support schedule tasks. Turn on AC before you even walk in the door, and get relief from the heat the second you get in the house!
2. Hub Plus now can control lights with infrared capability.

We fixed problems you reported to us earlier:
1. Data not found when using smart learning for certain IR controlled devices.
2. Some description improvement.
3. Others.

If you have any suggestion or question, please reach support@wondertechlabs.com.

1. Bug fixes.
2. Improvements of the appliance infrared library.

New:
1. We have polished the procedure of 1 click smart learning for infrared devices. Now you can test whether buttons are working correctly before saving.

Fixed:
1. Some minor improvements.

Fixed:
1. Some minor improvements.

New:
1. We have polished things up with customization for most known device types (TV, light, etc., excluding AC, coming next version) to make things easier for you. Each button can be selectively tested before you save them.
2. Now you can click "I" icon under any SwitchBot of Device List, you will find some detailed info than before about setting up Alexa and Google Assistant.
3. We show clearly when you have set AUTO mode for your air conditioner.

Fixed:
1. If you are using timer schedule feature for Hub Plus infrared control, in some rare cases the repeat dates are not shown in a right sequence. We fixed it to be comfortable for you.

New:
You can have more thorough tests when selecting remote models.

Fix:
We improve the accuracy and stability for infrared remote control.

New:
- We improved the procedure design and description of adding IR appliances for SwitchBot Hub devices, so you are less likely getting confused.
- SwitchBot Humidifier has been optimized to support "running out of water" alert locally and remotely. Always get notified properly wherever you are.
- We improved IR remote device type support for customized buttons for SwitchBot Hub devices. Now you can easily get it right when adding a customized remote button to your TV appliance template.

Fixed:
- Improved the display of Wi-Fi SSID for SwitchBot Hub devices, including when having spaces in SSID.
- Fixed the truncated texts of Meter alert condition on some mobile phone models.
- Fixed the Meter history data exporting problem on some iPad models.
- Fixed the problem of could not accessing model list after selecting some home appliance types for SwitchBot Hub devices Smart Learning modes.

New:
- We improved the procedure design and description of adding IR appliances for SwitchBot Hub devices, so you are less likely getting confused.
- SwitchBot Humidifier has been optimized to support "running out of water" alert locally and remotely. Always get notified properly wherever you are.
- We improved IR remote device type support for customized buttons for SwitchBot Hub devices. Now you can easily get it right when adding a customized remote button to your TV appliance template.

Fixed:
- Improved the display of Wi-Fi SSID for SwitchBot Hub devices, including when having spaces in SSID.
- Fixed the truncated texts of Meter alert condition on some mobile phone models.
- Fixed the Meter history data exporting problem on some iPad models.
- Fixed the problem of could not accessing model list after selecting some home appliance types for SwitchBot Hub devices Smart Learning modes.

New:
- A better Meter history with a more intuitive design. Now you have a "Year" view, a better Y-axis with "Max", "Min" and "Avg." data, and a smoother scrolling and pinch to zoom experience.
- "Add Appliance" gets easier in SwitchBot Hub devices, with the top brands recommended for you.
- A better support. A push notification will be sent to you when we reply your feedback and suggestions.
Fixed:
- Improved "Schedule" in SwitchBot Hub devices
- Improved "Scene"

Fixed:
- Meter data is not retrieved correctly through Siri shortcut.

Need more help? Go to "Feedback" in the left menu on the app home page.

- Added Sort Mode on the Home page where the display order of devices can now be changed
- Added a brand new Add a Device page where SwitchBot products and IR appliances can be easily added to your account
- Shortcuts of IR applicances are now displayed on the Home page so they can be quickly accessed and controlled
- Optimized Pin to home page feature and rename it to Pin to Top
- Minor bug fixes

Need more help? Go to Feedback in the left menu on the Home page.

- Added Privacy Policy option in the Registration page. Users must agree to the Privacy Policy before creating an account
- Optimized the battery status of Curtain. Optimized Illuminance Level and the graph in Light Sensing (Beta)
- Added I Rail Type Curtain Installation Guide upon adding a new Curtain and in FAQ
- Enabled changing the Hub a SwitchBot device is connected to in Cloud Service
- Improved the granularity of the temperature value of Meter to 0.5 celsius in Desired Conditions and Scene
- Fixed minor bugs

We are excited to bring you the major update with the following features,
- Enjoy the new looks on iOS, iPadOS, watchOS apps!
- Amazing news for Apple Watch users! View device status, control devices, and trigger manual scenes on your Apple Watch through Wi-Fi or data plan! Siri is supported too!
- Control SwitchBot devices through the rapid control popup by tapping a device card on the Home page. Supported devices include Bot, Meter, Curtain, Plug, and Humidifier.
- Enter a device’s detail page by tapping the More button on the rapid control popup or tapping a device card on the Home page.
- Enter a device’s settings page by tapping the top right icon on the device’s detail page.
- View or change device settings remotely. Devices that must be placed within the communication range of a Hub Mini include Bot, Meter, Curtain, and Remote.
- Sign in, sign out, change the app preference, submit feedback and more on the Profile page.
- Create and trigger scenes on the Scene page.
- On Curtain's detail page, change the Slider Control Mode to control two grouped Curtains separately through the slider
- Watch the new Curtain Uninstallation video on Curtain’s FAQ page.

We are constantly improving the product experience. Users' voices matter a lot to us. If you encounter problems or you have anything to say to us, go to Feedback on the Profile page.

We are excited to bring you the major update with the following features,
- Enjoy the new looks on iOS, iPadOS, watchOS apps!
- Amazing news for Apple Watch users! View device status, control devices, and trigger manual scenes on your Apple Watch through Wi-Fi or data plan! Siri is supported too!
- Control SwitchBot devices through the rapid control popup by tapping a device card on the Home page. Supported devices include Bot, Meter, Curtain, Plug, and Humidifier.
- Enter a device’s detail page by tapping the More button on the rapid control popup or tapping a device card on the Home page.
- Enter a device’s settings page by tapping the top right icon on the device’s detail page.
- View or change device settings remotely. Devices that must be placed within the communication range of a Hub Mini include Bot, Meter, Curtain, and Remote.
- Sign in, sign out, change the app preference, submit feedback and more on the Profile page.
- Create and trigger scenes on the Scene page.
- On Curtain's detail page, change the Slider Control Mode to control two grouped Curtains separately through the slider
- Watch the new Curtain Uninstallation video on Curtain’s FAQ page.

- Added support for 600+ remote control models of TV, Air Conditioner, and Light for Hub Mini.
- French is now supported in Profile > Preference > Language.
- Fixed some bugs.
